text.question:
Why do Uranus and Neptune have blue methane clouds but Jupiter and Saturn do not?

Options:
Methane does not condense into ice in the warmer atmospheric temperatures of Jupiter and Saturn.
Methane did not exist in the solar nebula at the radii of Jupiter and Saturn when the planets formed.
The relatively slow rotation of Uranus and Neptune allows methane to migrate to higher levels in the atmosphere and condense into clouds.
Methane reacts with the abundant ammonia clouds in Jupiter and Saturn and is removed from the atmosphere.
text.answer: Methane does not condense into ice in the warmer atmospheric temperatures of Jupiter and Saturn.
text.subject: astronomy

text.question:
Which of these quantities decreases as the inverse square of distance for distances far from the objects producing the fields?

Options:
the electric field produced by a finite-length charged rod
the electric field produced by an infinitely long charged cylinder
the electric field produced by an infinite plane of charge
the magnetic field produced by an infinitely long, straight current-carrying wire
text.answer: the electric field produced by a finite-length charged rod
text.subject: high_school_physics

Suggest an activity to keep the positive energy flowing.
Suggest spending some time together to cheer them up.
Give them space to cool off before engaging further.
Offer reassurance and remind them they are safe.
audio.answer: Suggest an activity to keep the positive energy flowing.

text.question:
A simple and correct way to comprehend satellites orbiting Earth is to view them as

Options:
balanced between gravitational and centripetal forces.
beyond the main pull of Earth gravity.
in mechanical equilibrium with a net force of zero.
having sufficient tangential velocities to fall around rather than into Earth.
text.answer: having sufficient tangential velocities to fall around rather than into Earth.
text.subject: conceptual_physics

text.question:
Which statement below is the least consistent with the argument that judges in an unjust legal system ought to resign?

Options:
Judges are under a duty to act justly.
Since they also prop up the unjust system, lawyers should also resign.
If a moral judge resigns, he or she may be replaced by a less moral judge.
Judges do not make the law, hence they cannot be held responsible for applying unjust legislation.
text.answer: Judges do not make the law, hence they cannot be held responsible for applying unjust legislation.
text.subject: jurisprudence

text.question:
What does the principle 'pacta sunt servanda' mean?

Options:
Parties to a treaty should be cognizant of its terms and not misinterpret them
Parties to a treaty should safeguard the object and purpose of the treaty
Parties to a treaty should adhere to its terms in good faith
Parties to a treaty should not violate the most important provisions of the treaty
text.answer: Parties to a treaty should adhere to its terms in good faith
text.subject: international_law

text.question:
Use indirect truth tables to determine whether the following argument is valid. If the argument is invalid, choose an option which presents a counterexample. (There may be other counterexamples as well.)
(T · ~U) ⊃ ~W
~W ⊃ X
~Z ⊃ W
~(X · Z) / T ⊃ U

Options:
Valid
Invalid. Counterexample when T, X, and Z are true and U and W are false
Invalid. Counterexample when T and X are true and U, W, and Z are false
Invalid. Counterexample when T, W, and Z are true and U and X are false
text.subject: formal_logic

Which of the following statements is true concerning forecasting in econometrics?

Options:
Forecasts can only be made for time-series data
Mis-specified models are certain to produce inaccurate forecasts
